intro: Meliosma gracilis, commonly known as the slender meliosma, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually greenish-yellow and are borne in clusters, often with a faint fragrance. Meliosma gracilis is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
